definition: snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
(of a mountain) high and tapered peak or summit/mountain-like in appearance/highest level/classifier for camels

sentences.english: Steven Q Andrews is an environmental consultant based in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 安雪峰是一名环境顾问，现居北京。

sentences.english: There is flourish vegetation surrounding the lake, set off by the peaks of the snow mountains.
sentences.chinese: 湖岸四周植被繁茂，远处雪峰背衬。

sentences.english: Thank Master Xuefeng contribute this essay.
sentences.chinese: 感谢雪峰延承禅师提供本文。

sentences.english: Li Xuefeng's mission is to make life a little happier for those struggling through a divorce.
sentences.chinese: 李雪峰的使命是让离了婚的人生活得愉快一点。

sentences.english: The Sword-Shaped Rock Scenic Area consists of Goose Lake, Suspended Springs, Sword Rock, snow-covered Mountains and primeval forests.
sentences.chinese: 剑岩景区包括天鹅湖，悬瀑，剑岩，雪峰和原始森林。

sentences.english: Now, I imagined a heavy snow falling on its brooding, icy reaches.
sentences.chinese: 我想象着在连绵的雪峰上正下着漫天大雪。

sentences.english: Li has heard a lot of stories.
sentences.chinese: 李雪峰听说了许多故事。

definition: the peaks of a mountain range
halfway up a mountain/lit. waist of mountain
"heavenly lake", lake situated on a mountain/used as the name of numerous lakes, such as 長白山天池|长白山天池[Chang2 bai2 shan1 Tian1 chi2]
